item.title: Here’s One Reason Cisco (CSCO) Stock Is Down Today
item.description: [at TheStreet] - Cisco (CSCO) stock is declining after JPMorgan analysts said the company could be negatively affected by Google’s (GOOGL) growing cloud computing services.

Record Industry Continues its War on Free Music
item.description: [at Fortune] - Services like YouTube are seen as unfair because they don't pay as much as records used to.

item.title: Alphabet's Schmidt Says Next Great IPOs Will Come From Machine Learning
item.description: [at Barrons.com] - Alphabet’s (GOOGL) executive chairman Eric Schmidt today made his pitch for how cloud computing will move forward, predicting that “the next great IPOs in five years from now” will be built on machine learning, technology that lets a computer algorithm analyze patterns to come up with new approaches to information. Executive Urs Hözle followed Schmidt on stage and predicted that "Over the next five years I think we will see more change in computing and cloud than we have seen in the last decade or two." He said it was like the explosion of development in biological systems. Keeping up with the explosion of technology, he said, would be made possible by automation of IT operations, via things such as the Kubernetes program Google developed and has made an open-source technology.

item.title: Google Aims to Expand Online Access in Cuba (GOOG, GOOGL)
item.description: [at Investopedia] - With President Obama aiming to normalize relations between the U.S and Cuba, Google is attempting to improve Internet access for ordinary Cuban citizens.

item.title: Cisco Should Be Concerned About Google Cloud Progress, Says JP Morgan
item.description: [at Barrons.com] - Rod Hall with J.P. Morgan today reflects on the report today by the Jay Greene of The Wall Street Journal stating that Alphabet’s (GOOGL) Google division is gearing up to announce large new customer wins for its cloud computing service, writing that Cisco Systems (CSCO) should be concerned. Greene, citing multiple unnamed sources, writes that Walt Disney (DIS) will be among several high-profile announcements during a “Google Cloud Platform” conference that kicks off in San Francisco today.

item.title: Yahoo Digital Ad Dollars To Drop In 2016, As Facebook, Google Grow
